noun.description: A straight whiskey distilled from a mash having at least 51 percent corn in addition to malt and rye.
examples: he moved to the sideboard to pour himself a bourbon

proper noun.description: The surname of a branch of the royal family of France. The Bourbons ruled France from 1589, when Henry IV succeeded to the throne, until the monarchy was overthrown in 1848, and reached the peak of their power under Louis XIV in the late 17th century. Members of this family have also been kings of Spain (1700–1931 and since 1975).

origin: Mid 19th century (in Bourbon (sense 2 of the noun)): from Bourbon. Bourbon (sense 1 of the noun) dates from the 1930s.
